<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Default to treating all modules as separate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// By default this falls back on the legacy lookup method:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#39;getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib&#39;. The address returned by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib is treated as a strong, exported symbol,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// consistent with historical treatment by RuntimeDyld.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Clients writing custom RTDyldMemoryManagers are encouraged to override</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// this method and return a SymbolInfo with the flags set correctly. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// necessary for RuntimeDyld to correctly handle weak and non-exported symbols.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbol">JITSymbol</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#a2f54c196c4be75015b4edb4f4ac1a92d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#a2f54c196c4be75015b4edb4f4ac1a92d">findSymbolInLogicalDylib</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::string &amp;Name)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> override </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbol">JITSymbol</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#abb87ff0ecf55f84ec9306f54bfb25241">getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib</a>(Name),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolflags/#ad509c6d010720c4f71aeac1fba93f8cbaeb59403a31ee3f63734a411e9e42ddd8">JITSymbolFlags::Exported</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method returns the address of the specified function. As such it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// only useful for resolving library symbols, not code generated symbols.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If \\p AbortOnFailure is false and no function with the given name is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// found, this function returns a null pointer. Otherwise, it prints a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// message to stderr and aborts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function is deprecated for memory managers to be used with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// MCJIT or RuntimeDyld.  Use getSymbolAddress instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#a4e5d745e695dc62ebaec15f537af9fed">getPointerToNamedFunction</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::string &amp;Name,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AbortOnFailure = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
